src:
Cuek 'Ditolak' Fan, Sungmin SuJu Siap Rilis Album Solo
04 Nov 2019, 12:15 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Sempat terlibat dalam kontroversi, Sungmin Super Junior disebut akan merilis debut album solo dalam waktu dekat. (Foto: Dok. SM Entertainment)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Sungmin Super Junior akan merilis debut album solo. Pada Senin (4/11), mengutip Soompi, agensi Super Junior, Label SJ, mengonfirmasi hal tersebut."Saat ini Sungmin sedang mempersiapkan album solo pertamanya. Rencananya, album ini dirilis pada pertengahan November dan akan dilepas sebagai album fisik," kata seorang sumber Label SJ.  Bulan lalu Super Junior baru saja melakukan comeback dalam formasi 'lengkap' setelah seluruh anggotanya selesai menjalankan wajib militer. Namun Sungmin tidak ikut berpartisipasi dalam comeback tersebut. Sungmin telah 'absen' dari kegiatan Super Junior sejak lima tahun lalu setelah menikahi aktris Kim Sa-eun. Pasangan tersebut diketahui mengikat janji sehidup semati pada 13 Desember 2014.Absennya Sungmin tak ayal mengundang banyak rumor. Salah satunya berkata, ia sudah tak berkomitmen pada Super Junior. Bahkan, penggemar sempat menuntut agar Sungmin tak ikut comeback SuJu, serta meminta pria 33 tahun itu dikeluarkan dari grup.Rumor tersebut dibantah sendiri oleh Sungmin, yang mengaku tak pernah melewatkan waktu latihan. Namun karena kontroversi yang makin melebar, ia lantas memutuskan untuk tidak berpartisipasi dalam kegiatan Super Junior selama beberapa saat. Tidak lama setelah menikah, ia langsung menjalani wajib militer. Ia bertugas sebagai tentara aktif pada divisi 17 di kota Incheon. Sungmin resmi menyelesaikan wajib militer pada 30 Desember 2016 setelah 21 bulan mengabdi. Sebelumnya Sungmin sempat merilis lagu berjudul 'Daydream' pada Maret 2018 sebagai bagian dari proyek SM Station. (kir/rea)
text:
Ignore Fan's 'Rejection', Sungmin SuJu Ready to Release Solo Album
04 Nov 2019, 12:15 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Got involved in controversy, Sungmin Super Junior is said to be releasing a solo debut album in the near future. (Photo: Doc. SM Entertainment)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Sungmin Super Junior will release their debut solo album. On Monday (4/11), quoting Soompi, Super Junior's agency, SJ Label, confirmed this. "Currently Sungmin is preparing his first solo album. The plan, this album is released in mid-November and will be released as a physical album," said one Source Label SJ. Last month Super Junior just made a comeback in 'complete' formation after all of their members finished military service. But Sungmin did not participate in the comeback. Sungmin has been 'absent' from Super Junior's activities five years ago after marrying actress Kim Sa-eun. The couple is known to bind the promise of a lifetime semati on December 13, 2014. Absent Sungmin no doubt invite many rumors. One of them said, he was no longer committed to Super Junior. In fact, fans had demanded that Sungmin not join SuJu's comeback, and asked the 33-year-old man to be expelled from the group. The rumors were denied by Sungmin himself, who claimed he never missed training time. However, due to the growing controversy, he then decided not to participate in Super Junior's activities for a while. Not long after marriage, he immediately went into military service. He served as an active soldier in the 17th division in Incheon city. Sungmin officially completed his mandatory military service on 30 December 2016 after 21 months of service. Previously Sungmin had released a song called 'Daydream' in March 2018 as part of the SM Station project. (kir / rea)
